reviewText: This DVD came on time and in great shape.  It is a very good movie.  I enjoyed watching it and having it in my video collection.

The 1945 Canadian-made programmer BUSH PILOT wasn't released in the U.S. until 1947. SYNOPSIS-- Red North (Willis) runs a small airborne delivery service in the Canadian wilderness town of Nouvelle. Red's business and personal life are disrupted when half-brother Paul Girard (La Rue) makes a move on both his shipping territory and schoolteacher girlfriend Hilary Ward (Hudson). These are acts of revenge for an incident that occurred between Red and Paul during WWII. Hilary's brother Chuck (Perry) is also Red's mechanic. Hilary blames Red for not being available to fly after Chuck is killed in an air crash caused by highly volatlle nitrol compound. Red takes to the bottle when she leaves him. Thus, Paul is asked to transport scarlet fever vaccine to a lumber camp. Hilary offers to navigate for him. The medicine is successfully dropped and soon after, their plane develops engine trouble... "Bush Pilot" offers the scenic beauty of rural Ontario and a well-scripted good guy/bad guy plot with a somewhat predictable ending. No filler and a one-hour running time are pluses. ALPHA VIDEO offers bargain priced, often hard-to-find vintage movies that are ideal for those willing to skip DVD extras. Their transfers show no evidence of restoration, so quality varies from one title to the next, with "fair to good" being the average. Also from ALPHA: Granite-jawed Jack Holt and cowboy star Hoot Gibson are part of the company featured in the post-war atomic spy drama FLIGHT TO NOWHERE (1946). Parenthetical number preceding title is a 1 to 10 imdb viewer poll rating. (6.1) Bush Pilot (Canada/USA-1947) - Rochelle Hudson/Austin Willis/Jack La Rue/Florence Kenedy/Frank Perry/Joe Carr "Bush Pilot" TRIVIANA-- Screenplay by SCOTT DARLING, who at age 53 was found floating in the Pacific Ocean. Darling also scripted Charlie Chan, Mr. Moto and Sherlock Holmes pictures, and is noted (but not celebrated) for writing some of Laurel & Hardy's weakest post-Hal Roach comedies. ROCHELLE HUDSON was Natalie Wood's mom in REBEL WITHOUT A CAUSE (1955). After only two movie roles, AUSTIN WILLIS made a successful transition to TV, guesting steadily on many famous series for some 33 years. Typecast as a heavy right from the start, JACK LA RUE's last screen appearance was in the Rat Pack comedy ROBIN AND THE 7 HOODS (1964).
This is good for a laid-back, relaxing, non-involving stare at the digital monitor. It's old-fashioned kids' Saturday afternoon serial fare. I liked about 8-1.2 minutes of it.
GOOD STORY  KINDA PREDICTABLE  NICE PROP DRIVEN AIRCRAFT
It seems to be very predictable and has the look and feel of the 1950's era drama. The good vs evil is obvious and the girl is the prize. (now that is dated)
